references.paper_title: Gradient surgery for one-shot unlearning on generative model
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant as it directly addresses the problem of one-shot unlearning in generative models, a key challenge also tackled in the main paper.
This foundational work provides a comprehensive overview of machine unlearning techniques, which are directly relevant to the approaches explored in the main paper.
This paper focuses on unlearning in diffusion models, a specific type of generative model that is central to the main paper’s contributions.

references.paper_title: Salun: Empowering machine unlearning via gradient-based weight saliency in both image classification and generation
references.reason: This paper proposes a novel method for machine unlearning using gradient-based saliency, which is directly compared with and contrasted against in the main paper’s results.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces a highly influential architecture for image generation (latent diffusion models) that serves as the foundation for the experimental models studied in the main paper.
